channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-22892] Unable to compile query if CTE joined
item.description:
Repro:

CREATE TABLE t1 (a int, b varchar(100));

SELECT S.a, t1.a, t1.b FROM (
WITH
 sub1 AS (SELECT a, b FROM t1 WHERE b = 'c')
 SELECT sub1.a, sub1.b FROM sub1
) S
JOIN t1 ON S.a = t1.a;

java.lang.AssertionError
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.parse.BaseSemanticAnalyzer.getUnescapedUnqualifiedTableName(BaseSemanticAnalyzer.java:463)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.parse.CalcitePlanner$CalcitePlannerAction.genJoinLogicalPlan(CalcitePlanner.java:2870)

item.summary: Unable to compile query if CTE joined

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
kkasa The patch doesn't seem right. With the current patch getUnescapedUnqualifiedTableName from genJoinLogicalPlan returns TOK_INSERT string instead of actual table name. The test works because table name is ignored 

leftTableAlias = left.getChildCount() == 1 ? tableName : 
            unescapeIdentifier(left.getChild(left.getChildCount() - 1).getText().toLowerCase());

getUnescapedUnqualifiedTableName expects ast node of type TOK_TABNAME but in this case TOK_QUERY is being passed.

I think we can safely ignore calling getUnescapedUnqualifiedTableName if left.getChildCount is not 1 (since the table name it return is being ignored in that case). We should probably also put ASSERT in getUnescapedUnqualifiedTableName that ast node is always of type TOK_TABNAME

+1 overall
